reviews.review_msg: i love richard! he's really accessible outside of class which i really appreciate. though i didn't learn too much from this class (partially cause i don't like mobile anything), i really enjoyed the class discussions. he's also very friendly & approachable so don't be afraid to ask for help! he's also very accommodating & will listen to suggestions

Richard Smith is overall pretty bland and uninspiring. He is not going to provide you with any help outside of the classroom, nor is he willing to give you any sort of support. You won't like his courses, and you won't have any major takeaways either, so talk to your TA to gain the best experience when dealing with any of his classes,

Richard did a great job of laying out this course online. It was very clear about what needed to be done and there weren't too many assignments. The reading 'modules' including lots of videos and the readings weren't too difficult. The material was very relevant as it was about mobile devices. Topic changes each semester.

Prof. Smith is wicked, he's hiliarious and tells it like it is. Sitting in on his lectures is not boring, he likes to bring some aspects of his personal life into the picture, & if you're listening in on a lecture online (live!) he actually responds to your lively commentary. He's very open and available to all his students for help & smiles a lot

I don't for the life of me understand any of the negative ratings towards Linda.  She is the most professional professor SFU has to offer, is extremely nice, and well-versed in all her areas of teaching.  She rewards engagement, creates a learning environment whereby you obtain exactly what you put into the course.  Best course I have taken so far

You MUST address her Dr. Professor Harasim, she will flat out ignore you if you slip and call her Linda. This class was a mish mash of compliments for Lindas style and brilliance, editing and rewriting Ch's of her book, random rants and insults if you disagreed with her. No independent thought needed for this class, just skills in parroting

TERRIBLE PROF. Great class if you're interested in online learning theory but if you want a class about internet/social media, do NOT take w/Linda. She's rude & condescending to anyone w/different views, talks over students, & makes huge (inaccurate) claims w/out backing them up. Book is only about learning theory, & the class only uses 4 chapters.
Champion of Online Collaborative Learning systems.  Somewhat condescending to those who don't share her passionate view. Fair assignments and flexible w/ marking

Steve is a great prof. He really makes you want to come to class. He is not like any of the other stuffy profs in communication who are pretentious academics, he actually sees the importance within pop culture as an indication for now. Very modern. He also plays really good music before class!
Does not care about students and extremely unhelpful for students.

There are no lectures, just readings and youtube videos. The group projects are HORRENDOUS. We only had 5 people in our group when the average for each group was 8-10. She said there would be a peer review section at the end of the term. I told her in the peer feedback that not everyone contributed equally. My grade didnt change. Nothing changed.

This prof is honestly borderline sadistic. The amount of homework for this class compounds very quickly and by the end of the semester we have 3 assignments due within 12 hours of each other. She also hands back grades very late so you dont know how youre doing until its too late. Says to only email her as a last resort. Just bad.
assigned lots of readings, some of which weren't even related to class content. overall very messy course design with unclear grading instructions.
Had a terrible time in this class. She does not reply to emails and does not communicate well with TA's.
